title: Grimhaven - Charles Willeford's lost Hoke Moseley novel (PDF)
description:
If you know anything about Grimhaven, you know how impossible it is
to find.  This is a scan of the original manuscript of the unpublished
second Hoke Moseley book (after Miami Blues).

With all due respect to Betsy Willeford, I don't think anyone should
have to travel to a library in Florida to read a book.  If she didn't
want it read by anyone, she shouldn't have donated it with the rest
of her husband's papers.  But by making it available only there, all 
she really accomplished was to make it easily available to a select
few and prohibitively difficult and expensive for everyone else to
access.  Anyone not "geographically advantaged" enough would have to
spend hundreds - or thousands - of dollars (and significant travel
time) to share a few hours with this manuscript, and that imbalance
really isn't reasonable.  In fact, it's this situation - of Mrs. 
Willeford's own creation - that's resulted in the overpriced bootleg
copies being hawked around the net that she spends her time chasing
down.  Free distribution eliminates all of these problems.

For Charles Willeford and Hoke Moseley fans, this is the ultimate 
(disturbing) read.
